| A priest of Ghaunadaur:* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can flow under doors.
* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* has no head.
* is [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic") to eat.
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

A **priest of Ghaunadaur**, b, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). A priest of Ghaunadaur is a form of male [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(dNetHack\) "Shoggoth (dNetHack)") that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry. His counterpart is the [priestess of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priestess_of_Ghaunadaur "Priestess of Ghaunadaur"), which is a form of [drider](/wiki/Drider_\(dNetHack\) "Drider (dNetHack)").

A priest of Ghaunadaur has the same attacks as a shoggoth - two [touch](/index.php?title=Touch\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Touch (page does not exist)") attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive [acidic](/wiki/Acid "Acid") splash - and also has the ability to cast clerical [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). Priests of Ghaunadaur also possess [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"). A tame priest of Ghaunadaur may turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor").

Like a shoggoth [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), a priest of Ghaundaur's corpse is acidic to eat, but eating the corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of one has a 1⁄3 chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning").

## Generation

Randomly generated priests of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Shoggoth](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoggoth "wikipedia:Shoggoth")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Ghaunadaur](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghaunadaur "wikipedia:Ghaunadaur")***

The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of [H.P. Lovecraft](/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft "H.P. Lovecraft"), where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.

## Encyclopedia entry

Ghaunadaur, god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, is best known as a peripheral member of the drow pantheon. However, he is also an ancient, pre-humanoid entity, thought to have emerged from the primordial ooze, or even to have born that ancient life with him to this world from some forgotten home. Most slimes and oozes are mindless and unable to worship Ghaunadaur, but the deity is known and revered by shoggoths, from which its most powerful priests are drawn.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Priest_of_Ghaunadaur\&action=edit)*

Priest of Ghaunadaur

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
b priest of Ghaunadaur (No tile)
Difficulty 27
Attacks Touch 1d12 acid, Touch 1d12 sticky, Bearhug 2d12 suction, Cast 0d8 clerical spell, Passive 2d12 acid
b priest of Ghaunadaur (No tile)
Difficulty 27
Attacks

Touch 1d12 acid, Touch 1d12 sticky, Bearhug 2d12 suction, Cast 0d8 clerical spell, Passive 2d12 acid

Base level 20
Base experience 753
Speed 15
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -15 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 1000
Size huge
Resistances fire, cold, shock, poison, acid, petrification
Resistances conveyed cold, shock, poison

A priest of Ghaunadaur:

  • can swim.
  • can flow under doors.
  • can survive underwater.
  • has no head.
  • is acidic to eat.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • may turn against you when tame.

A priest of Ghaunadaur, b, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. A priest of Ghaunadaur is a form of male shoggoth that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the encyclopedia entry. His counterpart is the priestess of Ghaunadaur, which is a form of drider.

A priest of Ghaunadaur has the same attacks as a shoggoth - two touch attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive acidic splash - and also has the ability to cast clerical monster spells. Priests of Ghaunadaur also possess fire resistance, cold resistance, poison resistance, shock resistance, acid resistance, and stoning resistance. A tame priest of Ghaunadaur may turn traitor.

Like a shoggoth corpse, a priest of Ghaundaur's corpse is acidic to eat, but eating the corpse or tin of one has a 1⁄3 chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures stoning.

Generation

Randomly generated priests of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Shoggoth
Wikipedia has an article about:
Ghaunadaur

The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of H.P. Lovecraft, where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.

Encyclopedia entry

Ghaunadaur, god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, is best known as a peripheral member of the drow pantheon. However, he is also an ancient, pre-humanoid entity, thought to have emerged from the primordial ooze, or even to have born that ancient life with him to this world from some forgotten home. Most slimes and oozes are mindless and unable to worship Ghaunadaur, but the deity is known and revered by shoggoths, from which its most powerful priests are drawn.

A '''priest of Ghaunadaur''', {{magenta|b}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. A priest of Ghaunadaur is a form of male [[Shoggoth (dNetHack)|shoggoth]] that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the [[encyclopedia]] entry. His counterpart is the [[priestess of Ghaunadaur]], which is a form of [[Drider (dNetHack)|drider]].

A priest of Ghaunadaur has the same attacks as a shoggoth - two [[touch]] attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive [[acid]]ic splash - and also has the ability to cast clerical [[monster spell]]s. Priests of Ghaunadaur also possess [[fire resistance]], [[cold resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[acid resistance]], and [[stoning resistance]]. A tame priest of Ghaunadaur may turn [[traitor]].

Like a shoggoth [[corpse]], a priest of Ghaundaur's corpse is acidic to eat, but eating the corpse or [[tin]] of one has a {{frac|3}} chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures [[stoning]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated priests of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.

==Origin==

{{wikipedia|Ghaunadaur}}
The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of [[H.P. Lovecraft]], where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.
